metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15656 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
JIT optimizations involving the Javascript arguments object could confuse later optimizations. This risk was already mitigated by various precautions in the code, resulting in this bug rated at only moderate severity. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 78.1, Firefox < 79, and Thunderbird < 78.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15656` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 80.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '80.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:78.4.3+build1-0ubuntu1').
